channel.title: Question about usable vps
channel.description:
Alright, my friend & i are having a problem finding a windows vps, So can someone recommend a good vps to use, or something that will work without having to convert a shitload of files. Heres our options..
linux vps debian vps cent Os fendora ubuntu

item.title: Question about usable vps
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

bob2568:

… im not hosting it he is, hes asking because he is not familiar with rsps that well, so hes not sure what is compatible with the server. funds are not a problem… he can spend as needed. suggestions ?

If you don’t want to spend time learning how to operate through terminal, I’d just buy a normal Windows VPS. You can get a cheap one here.

Read full topic

item.title: Question about usable vps
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

Yeah I just got a bit confused, you said you wanted a windows based but listed everything BUT windows?

Read full topic

item.title: Question about usable vps
item.dc:creator: @Teem_Rocket Teem_Rocket
item.description:
@Teem_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“Angel Carlos, post:3, topic:524296”]ddos protect

those usually cost $15-$30 monthly[/quote]

Yeah… let me know how that $30 for DDoS prevention works out for you.

ON TOPIC: If this is your first time (lolvirginlol), I wouldn’t recommend choosing an Operating System that you aren’t familiar with. If you’ve only used Windows, you will setup your Linux Dedicated and say, “WTFRUDOINJAVA? I NEVER ASKED FOR THIS”.

Also, you say, “a Win. based virtual private server”, yet you list 3 Linux distributions? Call me crazy, but that’s a bit confusing.

Read full topic

item.title: Question about usable vps
item.dc:creator: @Angel_Carlos Angel Carlos
item.description:
@Angel_Carlos wrote:

if you are not going to host for more than a month i recommend none.

get 1 that offers a database (place to put files for security)
ddos protect
24-7

those usually cost $15-$30 monthly

Read full topic

[size=18pt]Gee, I think you might have meant, “Fedora”.[/size]
